routing.mileSystem: Continuous northbound mileage from Springer Mtn to Big Creek
routing.sectioning: Official BMTA sections (small lettered segments by trail junctions/road crossings)
routing.routeVariantPolicy: No official alternate routes – single primary route

difficulty.description: Moderate climb from Springer summit down to gap

difficulty.description: Rolling terrain with AT junctions
Moderate descent to Three Forks (water junction)

difficulty.description: Steady climb into remote area

difficulty.description: Ridge hiking with minor ups and downs
Descent to river valley; scenic bridge crossing

difficulty.description: Climb from river to highway crossing
Steep climb into ridge saddle
Short ridge walk between saddles
Descent to Skeenah Gap Road
Climb from gap into foothills

difficulty.description: Ridge hike then descent to Wilscot Gap road
Steep ascent from highway into remote gap
Short climb to Brawley Mountain summit
Steep downhill from Brawley Mtn to Dial Road
Easy road and riverside walk to Shallowford Bridge

difficulty.description: Uphill into Rich Mtn Wilderness, ending at falls trail

difficulty.description: Descent out of wilderness to gravel road

difficulty.description: Easy trail and roadwalk approaching Highway 515

Rolling terrain through foothills to road

difficulty.description: Steady climb and descent in wooded terrain

difficulty.description: Rugged climb towards Cohutta foothills
Short but steep segment along ridgeline
Rugged and remote ridge section

Rolling ridge walk with minor descent

difficulty.description: Short traverse through remote forest

difficulty.description: Steady uphill on Hemp Top ridge

difficulty.description: Ridge descent from summit to trail junction

trails.name: Pacific Northwest Trail
trails.continuity: Continuous cross-country trail (mix of trail and road sections)
trails.maintenance_level: Maintained by PNTA and partners; rugged, lightly marked in places

trails.classification: National Recreation Trail; Eastern Appalachian connector

end.name: Benton MacKaye Trail Junction, GA (Northern Terminus)

routing.mileSystem: Continuous northbound mileage from Flagg Mountain to BMT junction
routing.sectioning: Official Pinhoti Trail Alliance sections (1–31, Alabama & Georgia)
routing.routeVariantPolicy: One primary route; designated alternates (North/South routes in GA Sections 23–24) not included in official mileage

sources.name: Pinhoti Trail Alliance / USFS
sources.description: Managing organizations for the Pinhoti Trail in Alabama and Georgia

start.name: Flagg Mountain Summit (Southern Terminus, Coosa Cty)

difficulty.description: Steady climb off Flagg Mountain then rolling terrain along Weogufka Creek
Mix of singletrack and road walk; enters Talladega National Forest
Remote ridge hike over Rebecca Mountain, crosses US-231 at Bulls Gap
Rugged ups and downs through Talladega NF foothills; ends at Porters Gap trailhead

difficulty.description: Challenging segment through Cheaha Wilderness up to Adams Gap on Talladega Scenic Drive

difficulty.description: Rocky climbs and descents over Talladega mountains to Cheaha (AL highest point spur)

difficulty.description: Remote crest of Talladega Mountains; crosses Chinnabee Silent Trail; ends at Shoal Creek RS

Exits Talladega NF near Coleman Lake; rolling piedmont terrain to Piedmont trailhead
Easy grade along rail-trail corridor (Chief Ladiga); enters Georgia at state line

difficulty.description: Follows old roadbeds and rail grade (Simms Mtn Trail) toward Cave Spring
